utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Are we, uh, almost done here? I have to call my mother, get my daughter, call the hospital.

utterance.speaker: Officer Soltes
utterance.content: So he didn't threaten you?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Soltes
utterance.content: No fight?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Not really.

utterance.speaker: Soltes
utterance.content: Sounds like a yes. Was there any indication that something would happen?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Yeah… Every moment I spent with him. I was always waiting for something to happen. But this…

utterance.speaker: Soltes
utterance.content: And no idea where he is?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Soltes
utterance.content: These domestic situations, it's not uncommon to get cold feet.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Are you asking me to file charges? Just give me the paperwork. If Greg House steps foot in my hospital again, comes anywhere near me, I want him thrown in jail.

utterance.speaker: Female Patron
utterance.content: So… we can use any of these?

utterance.speaker: Luca
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Female Patron
utterance.content: And just do whatever we want to her?

utterance.speaker: Luca
utterance.content: That's what they're there for.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey. We were just getting to the good part.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Is there a good part? It was performance art.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: That's Afsoun Hamidi. She's a genius. She just won the MacArthur, legally proving it. Just had a retrospective at the Tate Modern. Nobody reads The New Yorker?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nope. But I subscribe to her patient file.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: House, you should relax. You had surgery this morning.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Minor surgery, removing a drain.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Put there during major surgery.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: My doctor says it's okay as long as I don't leave my hospital bed.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Which doctor was that — Seuss or J?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nurse.

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: Dr. Hourani wrote it in his chart.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I'm surprised he approved it. I'm more surprised you actually asked.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I do things like that now. I'm making some changes… like skipping ahead to minute 37.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What is that — paint thinner?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm not gonna watch a woman get set on fire.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Philistine.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Who's the guy with the notebook who can't decide what to do?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Her assistant. He's been instructed not to intervene. Spoiler alert — he does. For her, it is literally heartbreaking. Let the games begin.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Arrhythmia, high hematocrit, and inconsistent RR variability.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You forgot about the fourth symptom — being completely crazy.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: One man's crazy is another woman's art. Her work explores things like gender politics and self-image.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And the pressing issue of shaving your entire body in public while wearing a monkey mask.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: She saw her mom commit suicide and was abused by her stepdad for years.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Didn't say the crazy wasn't motivated.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Well, she took that pain and transformed it into art. That's better than a lot of the alternatives.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I still vote for nuts. We should run a resting-state functional MRI to look for increased activity in the dorsal nexus.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She's not nuts.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The monkey-mask-shaving medium really speaks to you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What speaks to me is she's elevated being full of crap to a genuine art form and made a fortune doing it. People that pay 20 grand for one of her video stills, on the other hand, really do need their dorsal nexi checked.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Maybe the paint thinner set off an allergic reaction.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Not without bronchospasm.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: There was a space heater next to her in the gallery.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Carbon monoxide poisoning. It fits. Put her in a hyperbaric chamber.

utterance.speaker: Jerry
utterance.content: Lisa. You're Lisa Cuddy.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What's this about?

utterance.speaker: Jerry
utterance.content: I'm sorry. I'm Jerry Barrett. I recognize you from the photos. They barely do you justice.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: The usual.

utterance.speaker: Jerry
utterance.content: I'm friends with your sister. She showed me your photos. I-I work at the bank across the street. Um, Julia's my client. She… wanted to set us up.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Oh, I-I'm afraid you have me mixed up with somebody else.

utterance.speaker: Jerry
utterance.content: N-no, I don't think so. I-I've seen many pictures of you several times. That didn't sound the way I wanted—

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I guess I just have one of those faces. It's nice to meet you.

utterance.speaker: Jerry
utterance.content: Yeah, s-say hi to Lisa Cuddy when you meet her in the office you share.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Oh, thank God. The I.C.U. isn't being attacked by giant radioactive spiders.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Did I text you that? That was meant for my dream journal. I wanted to return your stuff. Don't worry. I didn't go AWOL. I had my wife-maid bring it over.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: My sweater, a coffee mug, a half-used bottle of lotion, and a DVD of “Marley Me.”

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Given your thing for Owen Wilson, I thought you might want those last two back asap.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I don't get it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You masturbate to Owen Wilson.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I meant the box.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh. It's a symbolic gesture. I want things to go back to the way they were before we started dating — no more bad feelings, no more issues, just work. Thanks for coming.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I haven't even spoken to you since you hurt yourself.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I was self-destructive. It won't happen again. I'm making changes. I'm gonna stop doing stupid things.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Great. The smart thing to do would be to talk about why you did it. If you don't understand—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I think I could avoid putting another hole in my leg without talking about my mother.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Well, I don't want to find out you're wrong by getting another phone call from you in a bloody bathtub.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm a big believer that the best way to get past the past is to shoot it in the head, bury it in a deep pit, and pour lye on it.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'm just asking you to talk about it. You owe me. Forget about saving your life. You exposed my daughter to that obnoxious pirate cartoon.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Bring me lunch tomorrow, and we can plumb my depths.

utterance.speaker: Luca
utterance.content: I should have known the gallery wasn't ventilated enough.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Hey, if it wasn't for you, we'd be treating her for third-degree burns, too.

utterance.speaker: Afsoun
utterance.content: That was a mistake. He shouldn't have interfered.

utterance.speaker: Luca
utterance.content: I told you I'm sorry. I want to share your commitment, but it's hard for me sometimes.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Like when she read your love letters in the middle of the New Museum? Yes, I read The New Yorker.

utterance.speaker: Luca
utterance.content: That was a year ago. And we're — we're not together anymore.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Seriously, you weren't really gonna let that guy set you on fire. He was just a plant to get the crowd going, right?

utterance.speaker: Afsoun
utterance.content: If that's your interpretation, I welcome it.

utterance.speaker: Luca
utterance.content: Afsoun believes explaining her work limits its potential. But between us, he was real and a total dick.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No sane person would let themselves be burned alive for the sake of art.

utterance.speaker: Afsoun
utterance.content: My work is meant to force the audience to break with the rational and see things in a new way.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Fine. No sane person would let themselves be burned alive to "break with the rational."

utterance.speaker: Afsoun
utterance.content: I feel…

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Luca, hand me the oxygen mask behind you. Luca!

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Congratulations. It's a gestational sac. Can't see anything this early.

utterance.speaker: Ruby
utterance.content: I know. I just figured this would help me process what's happening. There's a lot we got to figure out.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We have almost eight months. You're not having doubts, are you?

utterance.speaker: Ruby
utterance.content: No. Are you?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Definitely not. Nice, cozy home for little Ruben. It's a family name.

utterance.speaker: Ruby
utterance.content: It's a sandwich.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Named for my family.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's just House.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I swear to God, stay out of my personal life.

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: Where is the downside here?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Huh?

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: Jerry is cute. He's a senior V.P. He kite-surfs in Costa Rica every winter, and he loves his mother.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Seasonally? Or is that just the kite-surfing?

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: Is this about House?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What? Like I secretly wish I could alter the laws of the universe, change who we are, and magically make it work out?

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: Yes, that's exactly what I'm asking.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: My sarcasm indicated no.

utterance.speaker: Julia
utterance.content: No, your sarcasm indicated you wanted to avoid actually saying anything. Look, Lisa… all I know is you seem stuck. And I don't like seeing you like that.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She got worse in the hyperbaric chamber. It's not C.O. poisoning.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I think we should consider infection and test the assistant. I couldn't get his attention. He was in a daze.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You think that's a symptom? He's in love with her. He was probably overwhelmed, couldn't decide what to do.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What's he been doing since she was admitted? Did he bring anything from the patient room to the treatment room?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: A few things — a handbag, flowers, stuffed elephant.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Does she seem like the kind of woman who needs a stuffed animal?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Who are you calling? Oh, of course.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What are you wearing? Oh, I can see what you're wearing. Go to her room.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Now go address the elephant in the room.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: This is a Nanny Cam.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The reason Luca couldn't decide what to do in the treatment room is the same as in the gallery. He's been told not to intervene. Congratulations. We've become her latest work of art.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: It shouldn't have surprised us. All her work is based on personal traumas. She's had Luca taking notes, videotape her treatments, collect things, like sharps and bandages. It'll all go into a gallery installation.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Well, then I guess as long as long as the exploitation is properly motivated, it's all okay.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Ultrasound showed a cyst on her pancreas — we drained it.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Why are we even discussing this case? She lied to us. It's opening us up to malpractice.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Our practice opens us up to malpractice.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: How do we know she's actually sick?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Her being sick is a clue.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She would have let that guy set her on fire for the sake of her work. You think she's scared of a little arrhythmia? She probably huffed paint thinner.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: She would have let him set her on fire because of the honesty of her work. Faking an illness doesn't fit.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thirteen's right — at least her conclusion was. Everything else was laughably wrong. If the patient induced pancreatitis and a heart attack, she'd be suicidal.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Exactly. She's risking her life all the time.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Exactly. If she wanted to be dead, she'd be dead a long time ago. Pretending to cheat death pays better than watercolors. Coxsackie B fits. But do a spiral C.T. of her biliary tree to rule out gallstones.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Fine. I'll get the C.T.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sure. I'd be happy to come with you. Thanks for asking.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You're supposed to stay in bed — doctor's orders.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If you really cared about me, you wouldn't be so obvious when you scheme to prove me wrong. You volunteered because you want to C.T. her lungs, not her biliary tree. You want to find fibrosis and prove your "paint thinner" theory. If I don't come with, when you fail, you'll pretend you never tried. I don't really have a choice, now, do I?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Since I've seen your paycheck, I probably shouldn't. Canned beans aren't so bad… as long as they're cooked over an oil-drum fire under a bridge with the king of the hobos.

utterance.speaker: Afsoun
utterance.content: I feel dizzy.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Pale, diaphoretic, tachycardic, B.P., 80 over 40. Internal bleeding?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Get her out of here and scope her.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Afsoun
utterance.content: Ooh.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The colonoscopy didn't find the bleed, so we got to look by your liver.

utterance.speaker: Afsoun
utterance.content: Luca, please. We need to document everything. Ooh.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Hold this.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I'm just below the celiac artery.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No blood.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Could it be leaking into her thighs?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No swelling, no asymmetry.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: So where's the blood going? Why are you looking down there?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: 'Cause I don't like beans.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You stood me up.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sorry. Should have scheduled my patient's internal bleeding for Thursday.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You're still playing the same petty, passive-aggressive games.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Got you to go all the way to the second floor of a building you work in. Boy, did I screw with you.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You said you were going to change.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Check the sign. It says you got to treat me with intensive care.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'm expressing my anger. You should try it. Right now, let's finally have our fight.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: All we do is fight.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: No, all you've done is pull pranks or have temper tantrums with Wilson, never me, marry mail-order prostitutes, make me go to your wedding—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Dominika is a licensed aesthetician.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You cut open your own leg.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So all this was about you?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You don't think it was even related? House, we've never even had a conversation about our breakup. You are obviously still angry at me. And it's hurting both of us.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wow, I hadn't realized the incredible healing power of lunch.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I know one conversation isn't gonna solve everything, but it is a start. It's a privacy curtain.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It wasn't working.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Lunch at 1:00, tomorrow in the cafeteria. You happy?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: How many of those have you had today?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don't know. Is "your mother" a number?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The patient is a fraud. I found a puncture in the dorsal vein of her left foot.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Shooting up heroin wouldn't explain—

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Not heroin. She was injecting herself with her own red blood cells. It caused her heart issues, and when her hematocrit evened out, we mistook it for internal bleeding.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It must have been a very distinctively shaped and awfully talkative puncture for you to get all of that.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Browser history on her laptop helped. She was researching blood doping among other things.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She was researching me?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: For months. This isn't about creating art in the moment. It's about you. She set you up.

utterance.speaker: Soltes
utterance.content: We sent a uni over to his apartment and the hospital.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yeah, he won't be there.

utterance.speaker: Soltes
utterance.content: Any ideas?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: When you find him, you're gonna arrest him?

utterance.speaker: Soltes
utterance.content: Is there some reason you think I shouldn't?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Knowing him, he'll be in a bar. He'll find one that matches how he feels inside. It'll be the most dark, depressing hole you can find in New Jersey.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Now you're just pissing me off.

utterance.speaker: Luca
utterance.content: I'm really sorry. I-I didn't know she researched you. I had no idea she—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If you don't know anything, then why are you talking?

utterance.speaker: Afsoun
utterance.content: Please don't take it out on Luca.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'll take it out on whoever I think will irritate you the most.

utterance.speaker: Afsoun
utterance.content: I thought you would understand someone who uses their work to deal with pain.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I didn't realize that search engines could look within the soul.

utterance.speaker: Afsoun
utterance.content: You're standing in front of me in a hospital gown.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What the hell was the point of this? What personal trauma are you exploiting. I’m… sorry — mining for its artistic potential?

utterance.speaker: Afsoun
utterance.content: My illness. I did the blood doping to intrigue you, but I was already ill.

utterance.speaker: Luca
utterance.content: Wait. You're really sick?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why me?

utterance.speaker: Luca
utterance.content: Do you know what you have?

utterance.speaker: Afsoun
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Luca
utterance.content: So tell him.

utterance.speaker: Afsoun
utterance.content: If I do, there won't be any game for him, and then there won't be any art for us.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why me?

utterance.speaker: Afsoun
utterance.content: I don't answer those questions.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You know, there's a lot of games I could play that don't involve dealing with narcissistic, manipulative poseurs.

utterance.speaker: Afsoun
utterance.content: But this is a puzzle tailor-made for you. You don't know which of my symptoms are real, which are fake, which ones I'm not even telling you about. I know that intrigues you. Do you really want to end it now?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You want us to waste a bed on her?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You took an oath… an oath to be cool. At least that was the one I mumbled under my breath while everyone else was doing the boring one.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Even if she is sick, which I don't believe, she also says she has a diagnosis. So it's either just a lie, or it's just a game.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So what? I like the game. It's fun. Go get a blood culture. Check for parasites and bacteria.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: This is the new House — half the leg power, twice the irresponsibility?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The new House is about making my life healthier. Never said anything about yours. Go get her blood.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I'll do it. He's going through a tough patch right now. If this is the distraction he needs to keep him in his hospital bed, I'm sure it's better than any of the alternatives.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That was incredibly condescending. Did it work?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Why do you keep ducking your wife's calls?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Ex-wife.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I'm sure she just wants to congratulate you about knocking up a 22-year-old nurse.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I haven't told her yet.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: But you have told her you're not gonna sleep with her anymore, right? How are you planning on letting her know? Just invite her to the bris?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm trying to let her down easy. Rachel never wanted to have kids. I don't want

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yeah. You are all about feelings.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I've loved Rachel for 20 years. What if she never speaks to me again?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She's gonna find out. It better be from you. You can't cheat your way out of this one.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: Afsoun
utterance.content: Oh, just the nausea.

utterance.speaker: Luca
utterance.content: She said her back was hurting earlier.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: What's the pain level on a scale of one to ten?

utterance.speaker: Afsoun
utterance.content: Five.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: How do we know we can take her word for it?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We can't. Fun, huh? Roll on your side.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Grey Turner's sign.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We're done playing. Your pancreas is releasing corrosive enzymes. It'll eat away at the surrounding organs.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: But you must know that. The doctor who diagnosed you would have said what will happen if you don't get treatment.

utterance.speaker: Afsoun
utterance.content: How many projects have we done together? You're always so worried. Have you ever gone wrong trusting me?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: That pancreatic cyst we drained — it's back, and she doesn't care at all.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You think she actually is suicidal.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I would, but how did she give herself the cysts? Tox screen was negative, and there's no sign of trauma.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: There is another explanation. The reason she didn't react isn't 'cause she wants to die. It's 'cause she knows she can't do anything about it. Whatever she has is fatal. That should narrow it down.

utterance.speaker: Luca
utterance.content: What are we doing here?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Testing a theory. It's based on some stuff you can't understand, like RR variability, and some stuff you can, like the fact that she shaved her head in an art piece four months ago.

utterance.speaker: Luca
utterance.content: That was a commentary on society's—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It was a commentary on the fact that it was gonna fall out anyway, and she wanted to hide why.

utterance.speaker: Luca
utterance.content: Cancer? Are–are you sure about that?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: See that tumor-ish thingamajig near her "brainamabob"?

utterance.speaker: Luca
utterance.content: Oh, God.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Are you getting this? Game's over. I won. Primary CNS lymphoma with associated paraneoplastic syndrome.

utterance.speaker: Luca
utterance.content: Is that really what it is?

utterance.speaker: Afsoun
utterance.content: Yes. Four months ago, I had some vision and balance problems, and New York Mercy diagnosed me. The tumor was too close to the brain stem to cut out, so they did a few rounds of radiation. But it didn't work, and they sent me home.

utterance.speaker: Luca
utterance.content: That was around the time you broke up with me.

utterance.speaker: Afsoun
utterance.content: We were having a fling. It wouldn't have been fair to involve you.

utterance.speaker: Luca
utterance.content: I'm involved now. You just didn't want to open up.

utterance.speaker: Afsoun
utterance.content: Luca, my mind was not clear then.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And then you cleared it. Then you realized you could use your death to make your magnum opus. Maybe you wanted to show that no one can cheat death, even an entire team of doctors with unlimited resources. Or maybe your first doctors didn't treat you like a person — just a series of symptoms. You wanted to re-create that depersonalization. And I was the man to see.

utterance.speaker: Afsoun
utterance.content: If that was what I thought, I don't any longer. You spent time with me. You took this personally.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, I didn't. And I don't actually think your piece is about anything. I think you just figured out that you're mortal. You're just a bag of cells and waste with an expiration date. You wanted to act out. You wanted people to notice. Maybe you even prayed for a different answer this time. I got a title for your piece — "It Doesn't Mean Anything."

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You're forging my name on prescriptions again.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No. What you just said implies that I stopped at some point.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: 20 minutes ago, I put a notice out to all local pharmacies to require verbal authorization before filling my prescriptions.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You have any idea how much extra work you've just given yourself? You're not gonna last a week.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I've been dealing with this for years. But it's over — your liver, your hearing, never mind the fact that each scrip you write is a separate felony. You will serve time, so could I.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You've chosen this moment to give me crap about my Vicodin use?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You filled this three days ago. Now it's almost half gone.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So is my leg.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It's a month supply. The amount you're taking has nothing to do with physical pain.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay. So maybe I am trying to numb myself a little, because I'm trying to change, trying to stop being self-destructive.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: So you can only handle not self-destructing by being self-destructive?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What do you want from me?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I don't know, House, but I'm worried about you. I don't know how many times I can watch you cut off pieces of yourself. Now it's the I.C.U. Next time it'll be the morgue. You're miserable. And you're angry. And I want you to actually deal with that and not just try to medicate the issue away.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No. You know what I feel right now? I don't feel miserable or angry. I don't feel good or bad. I feel… nothing… which feels great.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Moving on. In the direction of my house, where I got some more pills.

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: If you're discharging yourself against doctor's orders, you've got to check that box.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm a doctor. So, technically—

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: Wouldn't it be easier if you just checked the box?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why are you still here?

utterance.speaker: Afsoun
utterance.content: I'm going as soon as the nurse brings me something for my eczema. I figured it was irritated by the paint thinner poured on me in the gallery.

utterance.speaker: Luca
utterance.content: Does this mean something?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's not eczema. And it's not cancer.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's Wegener's granulomatosis. Biopsy confirmed that what you thought was eczema was actually a swelling of the blood vessels in your skin. It also explains the pancreatitis and the mass in your brain. And it's treatable.

utterance.speaker: Luca
utterance.content: Um… what's the treatment?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We could do steroids alone to shrink the growth in your brain, but it's much better to add another course of radiation.

utterance.speaker: Afsoun
utterance.content: Radiation? On my brain? But it made me fuzzy last time. It was harder to work. I am still slowed down from it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And it'll get worse. But, you know, dying can also do a number on your ability to think.

utterance.speaker: Afsoun
utterance.content: I'm sorry. I can't do the radiation.

utterance.speaker: Luca
utterance.content: They just said it was a better treatment. It could save your life.

utterance.speaker: Afsoun
utterance.content: My life's not worth anything if I can't do my art.

utterance.speaker: Luca
utterance.content: You have friends, people who care about you.

utterance.speaker: Afsoun
utterance.content: This is my brain, my work, and my life, Luca.

utterance.speaker: Luca
utterance.content: You have more. This is not some great performance piece anymore. This is just crazy.

utterance.speaker: Afsoun
utterance.content: I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: Luca
utterance.content: I can't watch you die… not when you can save yourself. Good-bye, Afsoun.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good for you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: So. Why did I ever ban alcohol from the cafeteria? Before I forget, there's a brush. Tortoise-shell handle, natural bristles — wasn't in the box. If you could look for it…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Like the Lindbergh baby. You dating anyone?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: We don't have to—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Look, it's just standard lunch conversation.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Not for us.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay, well, if you've gone over to the "we don't talk about things" side, then I've got a pot roast in the oven.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: No. I haven't dated anyone since you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, you know what they say — once you go gimp…

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: We s-should talk about your leg.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You think I have unresolved issues, and you are the unresolved issues.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Yes. But it's–it's — I think it's more than that. It's your life, your choices.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I did it to fix my life. No, wait. No, I did it because I'm a deeply unhappy person. No–no, I did it to get sympathy from you. I did it to piss you off. I did it because I'm not over you. Or I was over you, and I was moving on. I did it because I wanted to know what it's like not to be in pain. I did it because I want to feel more pain. Whatever the reason, it was a bad reason and a bad idea. That's all that matters. Good lunch.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House… talk to me!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I already did.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: No, you just parroted back what Wilson and I've been saying to you the last few days.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Get out of my way.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: No. Oh, you pulled a stitch. House, please just talk to me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You want to know how I feel? I feel hurt.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I know. I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's not your fault.

utterance.speaker: Afsoun
utterance.content: Did I make the wrong choice? Five years, through every opening, every installation, every day and every night, he was there the whole time.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Except the first time you were diagnosed. You broke up with him, and you had to go through all of that alone. Maybe that's the real reason you're doing this piece — so that this time you can have him with you. You still could.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Hi. Uh, Lisa Cuddy. Nice to meet you. I'm sorry about the other day. I — there were some personal things going on in my life, and I wasn't at my best.

utterance.speaker: Jerry
utterance.content: Well, in retrospect, my approach could've come off as a little creepy.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: No. On a scale from one to creepy, you were maybe mildly unnerving.

utterance.speaker: Loudspeaker
utterance.content: Paging Dr. Stateman. Dr. Stateman, please.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Rache. Sorry I ducked your calls. I keep making the same mistakes, but at some point—

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Chris… I'm pregnant.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I… didn't expect that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sorry. Just checking the stitches on my penis.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Your leg okay?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's healing.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Good. Just came to grab the radiation-therapy forms.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Afsoun changed her mind.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Get out. You made a decision.

utterance.speaker: Afsoun
utterance.content: I changed my mind.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Afsoun
utterance.content: Because there are more important things than—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Than what — than your brain, your abilities? It's where everything comes from — any meaning in your life, any happiness.

utterance.speaker: Afsoun
utterance.content: Not all happiness—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's already left once. He's gonna leave you again. You don't need to depend on people who are gonna let you down. If you do this, you're a pathetic hypocrite. You're saying that your whole life, all your work up until him was a pointless—

utterance.speaker: Afsoun
utterance.content: Why are you doing this?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House I can hear your phone ringing.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You alright? You go to lunch with Cuddy?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: How was it?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The pasta Arrabbiata was cold.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Why don't we get a drink? We could go to the Sawmill.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cuddy's is on the way. I need to return this.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You think she's going to have an emergency tangle?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It was on my mind. I want to get it off.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Want me to come?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If I get in trouble? I'm delivering a hair brush.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What just happened?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Get out.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What just happened?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Get out.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House, what are you mad about? Just let it out. You’ll feel better.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Aah!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're right. I feel much better.

utterance.speaker: Bartender
utterance.content: You want another one?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, I think I've had enough. What do you think I should do today?

utterance.speaker: Bartender
utterance.content: I don't know. Go home?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not tonight. Cheers.
